name: massively

extremely or very much: The film is a massively ambitious project. The company is forward-thinking and massively successful. See

More examplesFewer examplesRisk management companies have developed massively complex computer models and software to track and predict losses from storms.Some countries do indeed massively subsidize their agricultural exports.Inadequate testing could spell disaster for today's massively complex networks.
